subject: History
title: The Assassination at Sarajevo
description: A fast breakdown of The Assassination at Sarajevo for builders.

hook.text: A wrong turn by a driver led to the murder of an archdukeâ€”and the deaths of 20 million people.

buildup.text: On June 28, 1914, Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary visited Sarajevo in Bosnia. A conspiracy awaited him.

discovery.text: An earlier bomb attempt failed. The assassin Gavrilo Princip gave upâ€”until the car stalled right in front of him.

twist.text: Princip shot the archduke and his wife at point-blank range. He was 19 years old.

climax.text: Austria blamed Serbia. Alliances activated like dominoes. Within six weeks, all of Europe was at war.

punchline.text: A teenager's two bullets ignited a world war.

quiz.question: How did Gavrilo Princip get his opportunity to assassinate Franz Ferdinand?
options: He infiltrated the archduke's security team
The archduke's car stalled right in front of him after a wrong turn
He disguised himself as a local official
